de.griefed.serverpackcreator.spring.serverpack

Interface ServerPackRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<ServerPackModel,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<ServerPackModel,java.lang.Integer>

    @Repository
public interface ServerPackRepository
extends org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<ServerPackModel,java.lang.Integer>
    Our JPA repository for storing and retrieving ServerPackModels to and from our SQLite database. Provides methods for retrieving, storing, deleting. Calls must always be made from ServerPackService and not directly to this repository. It may seem strange, but this accomplishes a couple of things:
    1. Centralized access to the repository.
    2. Complete control over what happens with the data retrieved from the repository.
    3. Complete control over what happens with the data passed to the repository.
    4. Better management and overview of what we are doing with our repository.

    • Method Detail

      • findAllByProjectName

        java.util.Optional<java.util.List<ServerPackModel>> findAllByProjectName(java.lang.String projectName)
        Find all server packs using a CurseForge project name.
        Parameters:
        projectName - String. The project name with which to search for server packs.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of all server packs for the passed CurseForge project name wrapped in an Optional. I recommend to make use of Optional.isPresent() and Optional.get().

      • findByFileName

        java.util.Optional<ServerPackModel> findByFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Find a server pack by its CurseForge file display name.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String. The CurseForge file display name with which to search for a server pack.
        Returns:
        Returns a server pack for the passed file display name wrapped in an Optional. I recommend to make use of Optional.isPresent() and Optional.get().

      • findByStatus

        java.util.Optional<java.util.List<ServerPackModel>> findByStatus(java.lang.String status)
        Find all server packs by their status.
        Parameters:
        status - String. The status with which to search for server packs.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of server packs for the passed status wrapped in an Optional. I recommend to make use of Optional.isPresent() and Optional.get().

      • countAllByProjectName

        int countAllByProjectName(java.lang.String projectName)
        Count all server packs by a CurseForge project name.
        Parameters:
        projectName - String. The CurseForge project name with which to count all server packs.
        Returns:
        Integer. Returns the amount of server packs for the passed CurseForge project name.
